unit.name: 3 Panzergrenadier Division HQ
unit.History: The 3. Panzergrenadier Division was formed in March 1943 from the 3. Infanterie Division, which was a rebuilt division itself; the original 3. Infanterie Division was destroyed at Stalingrad. The 3. Panzergrenadier served in Italy until August 1944, when it was sent to the Western Front. When the Battle of the Bulge started, the division was in the reserve of OB West; it was ordered forward on December 19. The division had one panzer battalion, but in December 1944 this was equipped with StuG IIIs, not with tanks.

commander.Name: Walter Denkert
commander.PersBio: Denkert was born in 1897, and joined the Army in 1914. At the start of WW 2 he was a battalion commander in Infanterie Regiment 271. He later commanded Infanterie Regiments 47 and 8. In October 1944 he took over command of the 3. Panzer Grenadier Division.
commander.Title: CO
